radiographic_examinations.findings: The hepatic parenchyma appears within normal limits. The contour of the liver is smooth. There is no focal liver mass. Main portal vein is patent with hepatopetal flow. There is no ascites. The gallbladder is moderately distended and contains sludge and small stones. There is a trace of pericholecystic fluid, although no wall edema is noted. The sonographic Murphy's sign is negative.
No evidence of bowel obstruction. Fecalized content is noted at the ileal anastomosis site and at various areas throughout the small bowel possibly indicating slow transit.
